body_html:
@peterjc123 I can't build pytorch with vs2017 15.5.7 and cuda9.1 when I following instrustions in pytorch github mainpage:

c:\program files\nvidia gpu computing toolkit\cuda\v9.1\include\crt/host_config.h(135): fatal error C1189: #error:  --
unsupported Microsoft Visual Studio version! Only the versions 2012, 2013, 2015 and 2017 are supported! [D:\pytorch\tor
ch\lib\build\ATen\src\ATen\ATen.vcxproj]

I know cuda9.1 don't support newest msvc, but I have installed vs2015 toolset and vs2017 15.4 toolset by vs2017 installer. Is there any way to force compile using them?

body:
@peterjc123 I can't build pytorch with vs2017 15.5.7 and cuda9.1 when I following instrustions in pytorch github mainpage:
```
c:\program files\nvidia gpu computing toolkit\cuda\v9.1\include\crt/host_config.h(135): fatal error C1189: #error:  --
unsupported Microsoft Visual Studio version! Only the versions 2012, 2013, 2015 and 2017 are supported! [D:\pytorch\tor
ch\lib\build\ATen\src\ATen\ATen.vcxproj]
```
I know cuda9.1 don't support newest msvc, but I have installed vs2015 toolset and vs2017 15.4 toolset by vs2017 installer. Is there any way to force compile using them?
